thread.title: Former Mets, Yankees manager Dallas Green dead at 82 | New York Post
thread.title_full: Former Mets, Yankees manager Dallas Green dead at 82 | New York Post

author: Post Sports Desk
title: Former Mets, Yankees manager Dallas Green dead at 82 | New York Post
text:
Dallas Green, who managed both the Mets and Yankees and led the Phillies to the 1980 World Series championship, has died. He was 82.
The cause of death was not released.
Green, a fiery personality who became known for his bluntness, was a baseball lifer who began his own big league career as a Phillies pitcher in 1960. He went 20-22 with a 4.26 ERA in his eight-year career, which included a 1966 stint with the Mets, before reaching the managerial ranks for which he would be remembered.
Green became the Philadelphia manager in 1979 and won the World Series the following season. After the Phillies’ record dipped in 1981, he was let go, only to pop up with the Yankees in 1989.
After a brief, one-year stint, which saw him become another victim of George Steinbrenner’s quick hook, Green switched boroughs and managed the Mets from 1993-96. He went 229-283 before Bobby Valentine took over.
Green couldn’t stay away from baseball, though: He later became a senior adviser in the Phillies’ organization.
